translations.citizenship.title: Italian Citizenship Procedures
translations.citizenship.subtitle: We accompany you throughout the process to obtain your Italian citizenship
translations.citizenship.services.title: Our Services
translations.citizenship.services.subtitle: We offer complete advice to facilitate your citizenship process
translations.citizenship.services.s1.title: Consulting
translations.citizenship.services.s1.desc: We evaluate your particular case to determine the most appropriate path for your citizenship.
translations.citizenship.services.s2.title: Document Management
translations.citizenship.services.s2.desc: We help you with the search, translation, and legalization of necessary documents for your process.
translations.citizenship.services.s3.title: Process Tracking
translations.citizenship.services.s3.desc: We follow up on your process and keep you informed about its status and next steps.
translations.citizenship.process.title: Citizenship Process
translations.citizenship.process.subtitle: Learn the steps to obtain your Italian citizenship
translations.citizenship.process.step1.title: Eligibility Assessment
translations.citizenship.process.step1.desc: We analyze your case to determine if you meet the requirements to apply for Italian citizenship by descent.
translations.citizenship.process.step2.title: Document Collection
translations.citizenship.process.step2.desc: We help you gather all necessary documents: birth, marriage, and death certificates of your Italian ancestors.
translations.citizenship.process.step3.title: Translation and Legalization
translations.citizenship.process.step3.desc: We manage the official translation into Italian and legalization of all required documents.
translations.citizenship.process.step4.title: File Preparation
translations.citizenship.process.step4.desc: We organize all documentation according to the requirements of the corresponding Italian consulate.
translations.citizenship.process.step5.title: Submission and Follow-up
translations.citizenship.process.step5.desc: We advise you on the submission of the application and follow up until you obtain your citizenship.
translations.citizenship.requirements.title: Requirements
translations.citizenship.requirements.req1: Have an Italian ancestor who emigrated to Argentina after the unification of Italy (1861).
translations.citizenship.requirements.req2: Demonstrate direct line of descent through official documentation.
translations.citizenship.requirements.req3: The Italian ancestor must not have renounced their citizenship before the birth of the next descendant in the line.
translations.citizenship.requirements.req4: Present birth, marriage, and death certificates of all ascendants in the line of descent.
translations.citizenship.requirements.req5: All documents must be legalized and translated into Italian by an official translator.
translations.citizenship.faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
translations.citizenship.faq.subtitle: We resolve your doubts about the Italian citizenship process
translations.citizenship.faq.q1: Who can apply for Italian citizenship?
translations.citizenship.faq.a1: Anyone who can demonstrate descent from an Italian citizen, with no limit on generations, as long as the line of transmission has not been interrupted.
translations.citizenship.faq.q2: How long does the process take?
translations.citizenship.faq.a2: The time varies according to each case, but generally it can take between 1 and 3 years from submission to obtaining citizenship.
translations.citizenship.faq.a3: You will need birth, marriage, and death certificates of all your ascendants in the Italian line, from your Italian ancestor to you. All must be legalized and translated into Italian.
translations.citizenship.faq.q4: Can I process citizenship if my Italian ancestor was naturalized Argentine?
translations.citizenship.faq.a4: It depends on when they were naturalized. If they did so after the birth of the next descendant in the line, you can still apply for citizenship. If it was before, the line of transmission was interrupted.
translations.citizenship.faq.q5: What benefits does Italian citizenship have?
translations.citizenship.faq.a5: Italian citizenship allows you to reside, work, and study in any country of the European Union, travel without restrictions through Europe, and transmit citizenship to your descendants.
translations.citizenship.cta.title: Ready to start your process?
translations.citizenship.cta.desc: Contact us for a free evaluation of your case and start the process towards your Italian citizenship.
translations.citizenship.metaTitle: Italian Citizenship Procedures - Italian Circle Joven Italia
translations.citizenship.metaDescription: Complete advice to obtain your Italian citizenship. We help you with document management, translations, legalizations and tracking of your process.

translations.about.title: Our History
translations.about.subtitle: 136 years accompanying the city of Miramar 佛
translations.about.visualTourDesc: Relive key moments of our trajectory.
translations.about.videoTitle: History of C铆rculo Italiano Joven Italia
translations.about.originsP1: The Italian Mutual Aid Society was founded on June 29, 1889, becoming the first institution in Miramar, created just one year after the city itself.
translations.about.originsP2: In its beginnings, the society operated through a monthly fee that covered sickness and medication expenses for its members. This structure operated for decades, but with the arrival of healthcare providers, its original purpose began to lose relevance.
translations.about.originsP3: After World War II, a new wave of Italian immigration arrived in Miramar, giving rise on June 29, 1959, to the Italian Circle of Miramar, under the presidency of Alberto Caroso. This new institution focused on social and cultural aspects, organizing meetings, lunches, dinners, and diverse activities for the Italian community.
translations.about.timeline1889: June 29 - Foundation of the Italian Mutual Aid Society, the first institution in the city of Miramar.
translations.about.timeline1959: June 29 - Formation of the Italian Circle of Miramar, chaired by Alberto Caroso, in response to the new wave of Italian immigration following World War II. Social gatherings, lunches, dinners, and member birthday celebrations begin.
translations.about.timeline2000: Informal conversations begin between the Italian Society and the Italian Circle for a possible unification, driven by the need for generational renewal and institutional strengthening.
translations.about.timeline2002: June - Renovation work begins on the old Joven Italia building, ensuring an important cultural legacy for the city.
translations.about.timeline2005: November - Official merger of both institutions, giving rise to the current Italian Circle Joven Italia. Assets are consolidated and the membership base is unified.
translations.about.timeline2009: Sale of the Italian Circle building and start of construction of a second floor at the Joven Italia headquarters, with new classrooms and an additional hall.
translations.about.timeline2010: August 19 - Inauguration of the Giuseppe Verdi Hall on the second floor, completing an important stage of expansion for the institution.
translations.about.timeline2024: Celebration of 136 years of history, reaffirming our commitment to promoting Italian culture in Miramar and continuing with the dreams yet to be fulfilled that drive our institution.
translations.about.legacySubtitle: A cultural pillar for Miramar throughout the decades
translations.about.legacyP1: Since its formation, our culture sub-committee has worked professionally on programming annual cultural events such as Cultural Week, providing a space where artists, groups, and city institutions can showcase their talents.
translations.about.legacyP2: We have established a permanent monthly exhibition hall in our entrance hall, where talented local artists can present their works, and we regularly organize conferences, book presentations, and workshops.
translations.about.legacyP3: Our annual fashion cocktail, which started as a small event, has become a flagship event for the city, featuring top figures in the fashion world and raising funds for local institutions in need.
translations.about.valuesSubtitle: Principles that have guided our institution throughout these 136 years
translations.about.valCommunityDesc: We foster a sense of belonging and unity among members of the Italian and local community, from our origins as a mutual aid society to today.
translations.about.valCultureDesc: We preserve and promote rich Italian culture through exhibitions, talks, and events that enrich Miramar's cultural life.
translations.about.valEducationDesc: We offer opportunities for learning the Italian language and culture for all ages, contributing to the intellectual development of the community.
translations.about.valIntegrationDesc: We build bridges between Italian and Argentine culture, enriching both communities, as demonstrated by our successful institutional merger in 2005.
translations.about.valTraditionDesc: We respect our roots while adapting to new times, as demonstrated by our evolution from a mutual aid society to a comprehensive cultural center.
translations.about.valSolidarityDesc: We support our community as we have since 1889, now through charity events like our annual fashion cocktail that benefits local institutions.
translations.about.gallerySubtitle: A glimpse into our past in images
translations.about.quote: An institution that saw a city born, and a city that saw an institution grow, a source of pride for all Italians and for all their descendants. A dream that was distant and utopian, but which became reality through the effort of hundreds of people who dedicated part of their lives to making it happen. Today it is 136 years and that is many, but we still have dreams to fulfill.
translations.about.metaTitle: Our History - Italian Circle Joven Italia
translations.about.metaDescription: Discover the 136 years of history of the Italian Circle Joven Italia of Miramar. Since 1889 preserving and promoting Italian culture in the community.
translations.history.imageAlt: Historical facade of the Italian Circle of Miramar
translations.history.years: More than a century of history
translations.history.title: Preserving our roots, building the future
translations.history.description1: Since 1889, we have been a pillar of Italian culture in Miramar. We were born to support immigrants and today we continue to promote language, traditions, and cultural gatherings.
translations.history.description2: With 136 years of history, we evolve while keeping our Italian heart, offering a space open to the entire community.
translations.join.title: Join Us
translations.join.description: To join the Italian Circle, we invite you to complete the corresponding form. If you do not have two active members who can present you, we will coordinate an interview with members of the Board of Directors.
translations.join.instructions: Below we send you the link to join the institution. You will be able to complete your data and a team member will contact you.
translations.join.contact: To know the values of the social quota and more details, we ask you to contact by email at:
translations.join.metaDescription: Learn how to join the Italian Circle of Miramar, complete the form and receive all the necessary information.
